questions.question_text:
You need to meet the technical requirement for the EU PII data.
What should you create?

discussion.content: Referring to EU PII not NY. Ensure that documents and email messages containing the PII data of European Union (EU) citizens are preserved for 10 years. "D" is correct.

Selected Answer: D
Yep EU not NY, I fell for it too, this ones a test on how well you can read rather than your administration skills
Key word here is preserved!

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, EU is the what the question about.

Selected Answer: A
TR : Ensure that the users in the New York office can only send email messages that contain sensitive U.S. PII data to other New York office users
Data retention strategies will not be used in this case.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/retention?view=o365-worldwide
So for me, its possible thanks to DLP policy :
DLP examines email messages and files for sensitive information, like a credit card number. Using DLP you can detect sensitive information, and take action such as:

comments.content:
About Retention label (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/retention?view=o365-worldwide)

Retention applied based on conditions
- sensitive info types, KQL queries and keywords, trainable classifiers, cloud attachments

choices.D: a retention policy from the Microsoft 365 compliance center
choices.A: a data loss prevention (DLP) policy from the Microsoft 365 compliance center
choices.B: a data loss prevention (DLP) policy from the Exchange admin center
choices.C: a retention policy from the Exchange admin center

questions.question_text:
You need to protect the U.S. PII data to meet the technical requirements.
What should you create?

comments.content:
each office have email suffixes that include the country of the user, for example, user1@us.adatum.com

add '@us.adatum.com' domain for New york office? 
thanks~

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Done by adding an exception for the domain used by the New York office users in the DLP policy

Selected Answer: A
A - DLP policy as users in each office have email suffixes that include the country of the user. An Alert policy will not stop the action but merely notify..

Selected Answer: D
> Email messages must be monitored to ensure compliance
exception for the domain won't apply rule.
Create new rule at top: Content contains PII & sender domain is & recipient domain is .
User overrides : Allow overrides

Selected Answer: A
A - DLP with specific domain, isn't it?

Selected Answer: A
A ofc!

Selected Answer: A
Clearly A

alert policy doesn't protect sensitive data

Answer is A, and New York Office can only send email other New York office users (that contain sensitive data) so domain ..

Answer: A
Requirement: Ensure that the users in the New York office can only send email messages that contain sensitive U.S. PII data to other New York office users.
Solution: DLP with specific domain.

choices.C: a Security & Compliance alert policy that contains an activity
choices.A: a data loss prevention (DLP) policy that contains a domain exception
choices.D: a data loss prevention (DLP) policy that contains a user override
choices.B: a Security & Compliance retention policy that detects content containing sensitive data

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You need to meet the requirement for the legal department.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence from the Security & Compliance admin center? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: I think the answers are in the correct sequence. Assign permissions - Create eDiscovery Case - Create a hold.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/get-started-core-ediscovery?view=o365-worldwide

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to meet the technical requirement for log analysis.
What is the minimum number of data sources and log collectors you should create from Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct, 3 and 1, 
3 as SIEM appliances come from three different vendors..

Six locations but 3 different vendors, so 3 different connectors.
Log collectors can be 6 but it talks about minimum so 1 is bare minimum. Slow and inefficient but works at minimum
why 3 source?

comments.content:
Quoting user 'Contactfornitish' as "Six locations but 3 different vendors, so 3 different connectors.
Log collectors can be 6 but it talks about minimum so 1 is bare minimum. Slow and inefficient but works at minimum"
You can centrally set this up using the docker image. It will retrieve data for all locations.

discussion.content: log collector just need 1 ?
Shouldn't this be Audit Log, and then; Activity? as when clicking on Activity you can sellect "accessed file" as a next step?

comments.content: The filtering happens after the search has been run: "You can export the results of an audit log search to a comma-separated value (CSV) file on your local computer. You can open this file in Microsoft Excel and use features such as search, sorting, filtering, and splitting a single column (that contains multiple properties) into multiple columns." (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/audit-log-search?view=o365-worldwide#step-3-export-the-search-results-to-a-file)

discussion.content: 100% correct
